intro: Buesiella pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf buesiella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and usually display shades of white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Buesiella pusilla is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
